title: Can I play league of legends on linux?h
body: Can I play league of legends on linux? If yes, how?

replies.body:
Short answer is you can. 

Long answer is you wouldn't not want to, just strictly based on the fact that since it is not coded for linux, you have to run it in a windows environment.

Here is a link that will show you the different ways to do it. 
http://useopensource.blogspot.com/2007/02/five-ways-to-use-windows-apps-in-linux.html

I personally have run it on Linux in the past, however the experience was less than perfect.

There is a programm called PlayOnLinux that provides an automatic script to install most programms. LoL is usually up to date.

It started running perfectly the end of season four. Only now the new Riot store is starting to cause problems, but I haven't tried to updated my system yet.
I know one lcs player did/does.

There's [no official support for a Linux](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752654-Minimum-and-Recommended-System-Requirements), however, there are a lot of passionate players that have managed to get the client to work on Linux. There exist a number of resources on this, however, I find [this video](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mos0lPdfWRs) and [this post](http://forums.na.leagueoflegends.com/board/showthread.php?t=1946188I) seem to do a quality job at explaining how it can work.
